sentences.sContent: I felt I was doing well and my confidence began to grow.
sentences.sCn: 我觉得自己干得不错，自信心就开始增加了。

sentences.sContent: ...But the boost in investor confidence needed for the plan to work will take time...
...and professors who all provided significant support for students who lacked confidence about "belonging" at such a top institution...
...But this vote of confidence in Oprah sends a troubling message at precisely the time when American universities need to do more to advance the cause of reason...
...finds the initial blow to confidence far greater now than then...
...A shattering loss of confidence inspires behavior that overwhelms the normal self-correcting mechanisms that usually prevent a recession from becoming deep and prolonged: a depression...
...there is medium confidence that there has an overall slight tendency toward less dryness...
...confidence among those who intend to buy a car this year is at its lowest since it began collecting data on this measure in 2000...
...But some economists warn that consumer confidence is falling...
...But some economists say that confidence among car buyers is hitting new lows...
...they should share their expertise in order to build greater confidence in the sector...

phrases.pCn: 置信级；可信度；信赖水准；置信水平（等于confidence coefficient）

remMethod.val: con(表加强) ＋ fid(相信) ＋ ence → 信任； 自信

words.tran: 机密的；表示信任的；获信任的

trans.tranCn: 信任， 信赖； 信心， 自信
trans.tranOther: the feeling that you can trust someone or something to be good, work well, or produce good results
